name: Wyrmsun
description: Wyrmsun is a real-time strategy game which features elements of mythology, history and fiction.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP (SP3) or higher Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo (Merom) 1.66GHz or equivalent Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Intel Graphics Media Accelerator 950 or equivalent Storage: 230 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo (Penryn) 2.53 GHz or equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel Graphics Media Accelerator 4500MHD or equivalent

reviews.review_text: If you like old school strategy games like War Wind and Warcraft, this game should be right up your alley. In case the trailer was too subtle, the multiplayer is Direct IP only; fantastic for LANs, not so much for anything wider.
I love this game I love the art the gameplay and the campaign I highly recommend it!

this game plays like warcraft II. it adds in multiple new features such as custom hero units to use in each campaign and they can carry and use items that may help or hinder them in battle. each individual regular unit has a random unique trait that may help or hinder them and a randomized name based off of what civilization they come from. individuals can gain experience and level up making that unit stronger.   bullet points of other features cuz i'm lazy  -units show upgrades, if you upgrade your swordsmen with shields, you see them using shields -easily moddable -in game encyclopedia -grand strategy mode -no microtransactions -Warcraft II nostalgia -very active developers -2 playable races currently with multiple other unplayable ones -haven't experienced any bugs or crashes yet
Were Blizzard to release The Lost Vikings: RTS instead of Warcraft, it would look something like this.

This game is actually pretty cool, it contain lots of stuff that Im really intersted in. I just want the game maker to maybe add some more playable races or factions. that will be a lot of fun.

This game is really a very horribly done warcraft mod that somewhere between warcraft 1 and 2, first ill start off with the cons.  CONS:  1) The randomly generated maps are used on missions that they should not.  2) There are too many conditions to mission completion on most of the dwarven missions.  3) Storyline is bland and is barely worth reading.  4) The tech tree system seems like a good idea but it actually is slightly annoying, because you need to complete missions for tech points but you can reset your tech tree at any time for free.  5) Missions where you are not allowed to build and just have a set number of troops are usually very broken, this is due to the random map generation. You just have to keep trying to get the 'right' generation, and or reduce the difficulty.  6) The tilesets, other than the trees are really rather unatractive and gloomy. Regardless of where you are.   7) The AI having unlimited resources, is very annoying especially on certain missions, on a number of missions i had to play for an additional 20 minutes just because of this. Also the unlimited resources forces you down, 'the set conpletion path' meaning there is only one way to do each mission most of the time.  8) The AI is not very smart, in fact its really rather dumb.   PROS:  1) mhm... nope cant think of one.
